title: DuBois on double consciousness - point of view

content.prompt: Which of the following best describes Du Bois’s point of view on the concept of double consciousness?

choices.label: Double consciousness reflected the hopelessness of many African Americans’ position in society.
Double consciousness had positive and negative impacts on African American society.
The term double consciousness reflected the unique ability of African Americans to advance politically.
The idea of double consciousness was limited to a specific time and had little long-term impact.

topic.text: 3.7: The Color Line and Double Consciousness in American Society

skill.text: 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's perspective, purpose, context, and audience.
